intro: Dendrocnide longifolia, commonly known as the longleaf stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its hairy, serrated leaves and small greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Its stems are covered in fine, toxic hairs that can cause skin irritation upon contact. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as rainforests and understorey environments.
